In Japan, a manga artist has predicted a disaster in early July, causing a drop in tourism
subhead: The 'prediction' made by a manga author has sparked panic and a decline in bookings around July 5, the day that she claims an earthquake will trigger a massive tsunami. Authorities have reiterated that it is impossible to predict earthquakes.

title: Orcas use kelp to scratch each other's backs, like a natural loofah
subhead: This grooming behavior involving an especially crafted tool marks a first among marine mammals.

title: Israel limits entry of baby formula in Gaza as infants die of hunger
subhead: While waiting to enter Gaza on a medical aid mission, an American doctor watched Israeli security forces confiscate the cans of powdered baby formula packed in his luggage. The vital product is desperately lacking in the Palestinian enclave, where about 50 children have died of hunger since March.

title: In Switzerland, an F-35 fighter jet deal has turned into a national scandal
subhead: The purchase of 36 next-generation American fighter jets will cost far more than the six billion Swiss francs initially announced in 2022. They might also be delivered under-equipped in terms of weaponry.

title: The scientists tracking Himalayan glaciers' melting: 'Yala holds a very special place in my heart'
subhead: 'The Himalayas Overheating' (2/6): The mountain range is home to 54,000 of the planet's 200,000 glaciers, whose accelerating melting threatens locals and worries scientists. Researchers are seeking means for the challenging research expeditions crucial to understanding Nepal's ice masses.
byline: By Carole Dieterich (Yala glacier (Nepal), special correspondent)
